epics.description: Establish a production-grade multi-module Kotlin architecture (domain, data, feature layers) with MVVM, Dependency Injection, clear boundaries, dependency direction rules, ADR log, static analysis (detekt, lint, dependency guard), code coverage gating, and baseline performance & memory profiling harness.

epics.summary: E2 - Frictionless Google Sign-In & Account Lifecycle
epics.description: Provide one-tap Google authentication (Credential Manager + Firebase), token refresh & secure storage, backend session validation, sign-out, and minimal profile bootstrap without manual text entry. Login optional for reading content.

epics.summary: E3 - CI/CD, Quality Gates & Release Automation
epics.description: Set up GitHub + GitLab mirrored pipelines with full Jira integration (webhooks, issue linking, pipeline triggers): build matrix, detekt & lint, unit & instrumentation tests, coverage thresholds, dependency & security scans, artifact signing, Play Console internal track deployment, versioning & changelog automation.

epics.summary: E4 - Holistic Test Strategy & Quality Tooling
epics.description: Define and implement layered test strategy (unit, integration, DAO, UI Compose tests, snapshot/visual, performance smoke) with fixtures, test data builders, hermetic environment utilities, and baseline failure triage workflow for TDD.

epics.summary: E5 - Article & Media Ingestion + Storage Pipeline
epics.description: Implement Node.js backend (e.g., Express.js) to ingest ~4 .docx articles (~40 pages each, with headings, lists, quotes, ~10 images, ~1 audio, ~3 YouTube embed codes per article), convert to sanitized HTML + plain text, extract assets with checksums, generate signed versioned manifest, create full-text search index (e.g., SQLite FTS or MiniSearch), and persist normalized content for client delta retrieval.

epics.summary: E6 - Client Delta Sync, Caching & Offline Integrity
epics.description: Deliver efficient manifest-driven delta sync (hash/version diff), resilient parallel downloads with retry + exponential backoff, integrity verification (checksums), Room persistence, eviction strategy, and background periodic sync respecting connectivity & battery constraints for ~4 articles.

Apply transport & data security (HTTPS, HSTS eval, optional cert pin strategy decision), secure credential storage, rate limiting, basic abuse detection, privacy policy alignment, and minimal governance for dependency vulnerabilities.

Integrate crash + analytics SDK (Crashlytics + Analytics), define neutral event taxonomy (no sensitive personal data), abstraction facade, logging strategy, performance traces, and dashboard documentation.

Provide a comfortable reader with Jetpack Compose: paginated/segmented layout, typography controls (font scale, line height, light/dark themes, dynamic color), inline media rendering (images, audio, YouTube embeds via WebView/API), in-article search, scroll & page progress, semantic accessibility (headings, landmarks), and footnote/reference handling.

Allow users to save, categorize, reorder, and manage bookmarks via folders/collections with undo, persistence tests, scalable data model for tagging, and global full-text search/filtering UI (search bar, tag/category filters, query input).

Enable precise text/media-anchored highlights, color-coded annotations, and strictly private per-user async discussion threads (supporting text, image, link/file attachments) with conflict resolution, secure local caching, and both in-app and push notifications (via FCM) for admin responses.
Expand README (purpose, architecture diagram), ADR templates, OpenAPI contract for Node.js backend, ingestion & manifest schema reference, and developer setup scripts for open-source readiness.

Provide secure (scoped) Node.js-based web UI on Linux server for ingestion queue visibility, retry/approve actions, viewing/responding to user discussion threads (triggering in-app and push notifications via FCM), and basic content health metrics without exposing other usersâ€™ private data.
Externalize user-facing strings, structure resource qualifiers, RTL & layout mirroring validation, language metadata in manifest, and preparatory toggle path (without translations).
Refine interaction flows, add empty/error states with guidance, ensure WCAG color & contrast, TalkBack ordering, scalable text, and dynamic color fallback for light/dark themes.
Optimize Compose rendering (recomposition auditing), pre-compute layout, lazy loading of heavy modules, cold/warm start tracing, memory leak detection workflow.
Prepare Play Store assets (icon, feature graphic, screenshots), internal testing track, app signing config, privacy & data safety declaration, and release checklist automation.

sprints.name: Sprint 1 - Foundation Kickoff
sprints.goal: Lay architectural scaffolding (modules, ADR process, static analysis), initial CI pipeline, and begin Google auth groundwork to enable rapid iterative development.

sprints.name: Sprint 2 - Architecture Hardening & Auth Completion
sprints.goal: Complete core architectural quality gates (coverage, performance harness) and finalize frictionless one-tap sign-in while seeding ingestion pipeline foundation.

sprints.name: Sprint 5 - Annotations Framework & Test Strategy
sprints.goal: Ship highlight selection + private thread MVP, observability baseline, and broaden automated test coverage (DAO, UI).

sprints.name: Sprint 6 - Security & Documentation Maturity
sprints.goal: Apply security hardening (rate limiting, credential storage review), finalize documentation (README, ADRs, OpenAPI), and prep store listing groundwork.

sprints.name: Sprint 3 - Ingestion Core & Reader Baseline
sprints.goal: Deliver DOCX â†’ sanitized HTML flow with assets + plain text and establish baseline reader rendering and pagination prototype.

sprints.name: Sprint 4 - Sync Engine & Bookmark Foundations
sprints.goal: Implement manifest diff + delta download with retries, initial eviction, and basic bookmark CRUD while extending ingestion for media placeholders.

sprints.name: Sprint 8 - Release Readiness & Final Hardening
sprints.goal: Finalize store assets & compliance forms, stabilize performance & security, close polish backlog, and prepare post-MVP experiment backlog.

sprints.name: Sprint 7 - Accessibility, Polish & i18n Readiness
sprints.goal: Refine UX (empty/error states), accessibility compliance, performance optimization passes, and internationalization readiness.

backlog.summary: Define initial module map and dependency direction rules
backlog.description: Create a documented module topology (app, core-common, core-network, data-repo, feature-reader, feature-bookmarks, feature-annotations) and enforce dependency direction (no cycles, forbidden reverse imports) using Gradle conventions / build checks.
Refine required modules, define allowed dependency graph (domain<-data<-features<-app), list prohibited pairs, capture in ADR draft.

backlog.summary: Core Implementation: Gradle module creation & build logic
backlog.description: Create modules, configure build.gradle.kts with plugins, Kotlin/Java compatibility, API/implementation separation, and enforce dependency direction via build scripts.

backlog.description: Add placeholder composable in feature-reader referencing domain interface to confirm dependency direction and build health.

backlog.summary: QA: dependency rule verification & CI check
